Articles.Content:
Hello, Kerbonauts!

Newcomer here, been playing the demo version of the game for about a week now and have to say I'm absolutely hooked, hoping to purchase the full version once I get my next paycheck. I've been lurking the forums since I downloaded the demo, so I figured I'd join and get into the community!

I look forward to being here, and can't wait until I have the full version so I can contribute somehow instead of just being a lurker.

- Vocosol

Hi Vocosol, welcome to the community

The alpha is definitely worth it, there is so much more to it than the demo, and there will be a lot more in the next update

Hi Vocosol, welcome to the community

The alpha is definitely worth it, there is so much more to it than the demo, and there will be a lot more in the next update

I've noticed that. From the few youtube videos I've watched, there's a ton more in the Alpha version than in the demo, which makes me sad that I don't have it but motivates me to buy it the second I get money in the bank. In particular, the idea of EVA, SpacePlanes, and landing on Mun sound absolutely awesome, plus some of the mods you guys have made here look absolutely fantastic. I can't wait to get the full game! I'm running out of ideas in the demo version
Well the Demo is pretty limited, land on Mun, return, land on Mun, return, Hmm I'll land somewhere else on Mun, return.....
Welcome to the forums! Hello from Aberta!

..land on Mun, return, land on Mun, return, Hmm I'll land somewhere else on Mun, return.....

Haha, as silly as it sounds, I haven't actually been able to get to Mun, let alone land on it! I'm positive if I did make it there I would more than likely crash, as it is. Need more experience.

Welcome to the forums! Hello from Alberta!

Alberta! Nice! Your profile picture.. wouldn't happen to be Steve from minecraft, would it?

Haha, as silly as it sounds, I haven't actually been able to get to Mun, let alone land on it! I'm positive if I did make it there I would more than likely crash, as it is. Need more experience.

Hello from rural Ontario! Keep practising, watch some tutorial videos (especially Scott Manley), and you'll be on the Mun in no time!
